@graph.name: Pumpkin Scones - JoyFoodSunshine
@graph.description: These pumpkin scones are buttery, moist, & full of rich fall spices & fresh pumpkin. They are even better than Starbucks!

@graph.name: What is the secret to making good scones?

acceptedAnswer.text: A few of my secrets are: 1) Make sure the butter is cold. 2) Don't over-mix the dough.

@graph.name: How do I get my scones to rise and be fluffy?

acceptedAnswer.text: The only reason these pumpkin scones wouldn't be fluffy is if your baking powder or egg weren't fresh. Test your ingredients for freshness before using.

@graph.name: How do you keep scones moist?

acceptedAnswer.text: Make sure to store them in an airtight container and they will retain their moisture.

@graph.name: How do you reheat & freshen up scones?

acceptedAnswer.text:
There are two ways to reheat these pumpkin scones:
In the microwave. Simply warm scones in the microwave for 15-30 seconds (depending on the power of your microwave and the number of scones you are heating up). Then enjoy!
In the oven. Wrap scones in foil (to prevent drying out) and warm in the oven preheated to 300 degrees F for 10-15 minutes!

@graph.name: Pumpkin Scones Recipe
@graph.description: These easy pumpkin scones are buttery, moist, and packed full of rich fall spices and fresh pumpkin. They are even better than Starbucks and can be prepared in advance and baked fresh in the morning for a cozy fall breakfast.

video.name: Pumpkin Scones Recipe
video.description: These easy pumpkin scones are buttery, moist, and packed full of rich fall spices and fresh pumpkin. They are even better than Starbucks and can be prepared in advance and baked fresh in the morning for a cozy fall breakfast.

recipeInstructions.text: Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper, set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper, set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl add flour, sugar, baking powder cinnamon, pumpkin pie spice and sea salt. Stir to combine.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large bowl add flour, sugar, baking powder cinnamon, pumpkin pie spice and sea salt. Stir to combine.

recipeInstructions.text: Add butter and using a fork, pastry cutter or your hands, cut the butter into the dry ingredients until there are coarse crumbs. (You want little chunks of butter)!
recipeInstructions.name: Add butter and using a fork, pastry cutter or your hands, cut the butter into the dry ingredients until there are coarse crumbs. (You want little chunks of butter)!

recipeInstructions.text: Add half and half, pumpkin puree, egg and vanilla extract and stir until combined. The dough will look crumbly, but should clump together when squeezed between your fingers.
recipeInstructions.name: Add half and half, pumpkin puree, egg and vanilla extract and stir until combined. The dough will look crumbly, but should clump together when squeezed between your fingers.

recipeInstructions.text: Add cinnamon chips and stir until evenly distributed.
recipeInstructions.name: Add cinnamon chips and stir until evenly distributed.

recipeInstructions.text: Turn dough out onto a well-floured surface (or pastry slab), divide in half and form two circles. Cut each circle into 8, equal-sized, triangular pieces. (to do this: start by cutting the circle in half from top to bottom. Then cut it in half from side to side. Then cut the remaining two pieces in half diagonally).
recipeInstructions.name: Turn dough out onto a well-floured surface (or pastry slab), divide in half and form two circles. Cut each circle into 8, equal-sized, triangular pieces. (to do this: start by cutting the circle in half from top to bottom. Then cut it in half from side to side. Then cut the remaining two pieces in half diagonally).

recipeInstructions.text: Place scone pieces evenly spread on the prepared baking sheet.
recipeInstructions.name: Place scone pieces evenly spread on the prepared baking sheet.

recipeInstructions.text: Lightly brush the tops of each scone with half and half, then sprinkle each one with raw sugar.
recipeInstructions.name: Lightly brush the tops of each scone with half and half, then sprinkle each one with raw sugar.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake in the preheated oven for 15-18 minutes, or until the scones look set.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake in the preheated oven for 15-18 minutes, or until the scones look set.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove from the oven and transfer scones to a wire rack to cool, or serve warm (which I highly recommend).
recipeInstructions.name: Remove from the oven and transfer scones to a wire rack to cool, or serve warm (which I highly recommend).
